     <h1>
      <span class="guidetitle">
       American Foreign Policy &nbsp;
      </span>
     </h1>
    </div>
    <div class="guideattr" id="guideattr">
     <span id="lastupdate" class="lastupdate">
      Last Updated: Aug 17, 2016
     </span>
     <span class="guideurl">
      URL: http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/americanforeignpolicy
     </span>
     <span class="printguideurl" style="padding:0px 10px 0px 10px;">

        Print Guide
       </a>
      </span>

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:758px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox17115966">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17115966">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17115966">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Getting Started: Selected Reference Materials
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17115966">
          <p>
           <strong>
            REFERENCE BOOKS AND WEBSITES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            CIA World Factbook
            <br />
            Online Location:
            <a href="https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/index.html">
             https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/index.html
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Credo Reference
            <br />
            Online Location:
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.credoreference.com">
             http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.credoreference.com
            </a>
            or search Encompass Search by title.
            <br />
            Credo Reference is a collection of hundreds of reference works, including general and subject specific dictionaries, encyclopedias, guides, companions and more--all online, all searchable from one search box.
           </p>
           <p>
            The Europa World Year Book
            <br />
            Online Location:
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.europaworld.com/">
             http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.europaworld.com/
            </a>
            or search&nbsp;Encompass Search by title
           </p>
           <p>
            Political Handbook of the World
            <br />
            Online Location:
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://library.cqpress.com/phw/">
             http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://library.cqpress.com/phw/
            </a>
            or search&nbsp;Encompass Search by title
           </p>
           <p>
            US Department of State: Bilateral Relations Fact Sheets
            <br />
            Online Location:
            <a href="http://www.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn">
             http://www.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            LIBRARY NEWS DATABASES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.lexisnexis.com/hottopics/lnacademic">
             LexisNexis Academic
            </a>
            <br />
            Full text of thousands of newspapers, magazines, broadcast transcripts, business publications, legal materials, and more.
            <br />
            Access: Library Homepage -- Research -- Databases A to Z -- LexisNexis Academic
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            OTHER WEBSITES: GENERAL
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Foreign Affairs Online
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.people.virginia.edu/%7Erjb3v/rjb.html">
             http://www.people.virginia.edu/~rjb3v/rjb.html
            </a>
            <br />
            Excellent guide for students of foreign affairs. Includes annotated links to the following topics: US Government, Foreign States, UN, NGOs &amp; IGOs, International Law, Human Rights, International Realations, Think Tanks and the Digital Divide.
           </p>
           <p>
            Foreign Relations of the United States (1861-1960)
            <br />
            <a href="http://uwdc.library.wisc.edu:2784/collections/FRUS">
             http://uwdc.library.wisc.edu:2784/collections/FRUS
            </a>
            <br />
            "The Foreign Relations of the United States series is the official documentary historical record of major U.S. foreign policy decisions that have been declassified and edited for publication. [...] This digital facsimile of Foreign Relations of the United States is a project of the University of Wisconsin-Madison Libraries in collaboration with the University of Illinois at Chicago Libraries. This is an incomplete run from 1861-1960 with missing volumes being added as they can be acquired and processed."
           </p>
           <p>
            National Security Archive
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.gwu.edu/%7Ensarchiv/index.html">
             http://www.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/index.html
            </a>
            <br />
            "Combines [...] investigative journalism center, research institute on international affairs, library and archive of declassified U.S. documents" and more.
           </p>
           <p>
            US Department of State Office of the Historian
            <br />
            <a href="http://history.state.gov/">
             http://history.state.gov/
            </a>
            <br />
            "The Office of the Historian is responsible, under law, for the preparation and publication of the official documentary history of U.S. foreign policy in the Foreign Relations of the United States series."
           </p>
           <p>
            WWW Virtual Library: International Affairs Resources
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.etown.edu/vl/">
             http://www.etown.edu/vl/
            </a>
            <br />
            Compiled by a professor of International Studies at Elizabethtown College, this gateway site is organized into helpful categories. It contains a great depth of high quality information and it has been reviewed and highly ranked by several respected Social Science sources.
           </p>
           <p>
            World Legal Information Institute
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.worldlii.org/catalog/215.html">
             http://www.worldlii.org/catalog/215.html
            </a>
            <br />
            Organized by country and then by subject.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            OTHER WEBSITES: FEDERAL AGENCIES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Agency for International Development --
            <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/">
             http://www.usaid.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Bureau of International Labor Affairs (Department of Labor) --
            <a href="http://www.dol.gov/ilab/">
             http://www.dol.gov/ilab/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Central Intelligence Agency --
            <a href="https://www.cia.gov/">
             https://www.cia.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Department of Defense --
            <a href="http://www.defenselink.mil/">
             http://www.defenselink.mil/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Department of Energy --
            <a href="http://www.energy.gov/">
             http://www.energy.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Department of State --
            <a href="http://www.state.gov/">
             http://www.state.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            Department of the Treasury --
            <a href="http://www.ustreas.gov/">
             http://www.ustreas.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            International Trade Administration (Department of Commerce) --
            <a href="http://www.ita.doc.gov/">
             http://www.ita.doc.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            International Trade Commission --
            <a href="http://www.usitc.gov/">
             http://www.usitc.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration --
            <a href="http://www.noaa.gov/">
             http://www.noaa.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            National Nuclear Security Administration (Department of Energy) --
            <a href="http://www.nn.doe.gov/">
             http://www.nn.doe.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            National Security Agency --
            <a href="http://www.nsa.gov/">
             http://www.nsa.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            National Security Council --
            <a href="http://www.whitehouse.gov/nsc/index.html">
             http://www.whitehouse.gov/nsc/index.html
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            United States Mission to the United Nations --
            <a href="http://www.un.int/usa/">
             http://www.un.int/usa/
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            United States Trade Representative --
            <a href="http://www.ustr.gov/">
             http://www.ustr.gov/
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt17115966" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17115967">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17115967">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17115967">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Articles &amp; Reports: Databases &amp; Search Engines
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17115967">
          <p>
           <strong>
            SEARCHING FOR ARTICLES
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            See a list of all article databases via the Library Homepage &nbsp;--&nbsp; Research&nbsp; --
            <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/databases-az.html">
             Databases A-Z
            </a>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            Check the
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu">
             Subject Guides
            </a>
            (follow the path: Library Homepage -- Research) for other recommended databases for this and other subject areas.
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <em>
            Use
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://ulrichsweb.serialssolutions.com/">
             UlrichsWeb Periodicals Directory
            </a>
            to find out information about individual journals, including whether or not they are peer-reviewed.
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            International Relations, Political Science and Specialized Databases and Search Engines
            <br />
           </b>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.ciaonet.org/">
             Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO)
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of scholarly journal articles, working papers, policy briefs, conference proceedings, and more in the area of international affairs theory and research. Full text is linked directly in the database.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/pais/ip?accountid=40980">
             PAIS
            </a>
            <br />
            Citations from scholarly journal articles, books, book chapters, policy briefs, government publications, and more from on domestic and international political, economic, social and public policy issues. Use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            &nbsp;buttons&nbsp;to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
           <p>
            PolicyArchive (Indiana University - Purdue University Indianapolis University Library and nonprofit Center for Governmental Studies)
            <br />
            <a href="https://www.policyarchive.org/">
             https://www.policyarchive.org/
            </a>
            <br />
            "PolicyArchive is ... digital archive of global, non-partisan public policy research. It [...] collect[s] and disseminate[s] summaries and full texts, videos, reports, briefs, and multimedia material of think tank, university, government, and foundation-funded policy research."
           </p>
           <p>
            Think Tank Search
            <br />
            <a href="http://guides.library.harvard.edu/hks/think_tank_search">
             http://guides.library.harvard.edu/hks/think_tank_search
            </a>
            <br />
            <span>
             "Think Tank Search is a custom Google search of more than 450 think tank websites. For the purposes of this search, think tanks are defined as institutions affiliated with universities, governments, advocacy groups, foundations, non-governmental organizations, and businesses that generate public policy research, analysis, and activity. Inclusion is based upon the relevancy of subject area to HKS [Harvard Kennedy School] coursework and scholarship, the availability of the think tank&rsquo;s research in full-text on the website, and the think tank&rsquo;s reputation and influence upon policy making. The list represents a mixture of partisan and non-partisan think tanks.
            </span>
            "
            <br />
            &gt;&gt;See also the "US" and "Non-US" tabs for lists of and links to individual think tanks.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/wpsashell/ip?accountid=40980">
             Worldwide Political Science Abstracts
            </a>
            <br />
            Citations from scholarly journal articles, books, book chapters, policy briefs, government publications, and more in political science and complementary fields, including international relations, law, and public administration/policy. Use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            &nbsp;buttons&nbsp;to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <b>
            General / Interdisciplinary Databases
           </b>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=aph">
             Academic Search Complete
             <br />
            </a>
            A database of both scholarly and popular publications in a wide variety of disciplines and subject areas, including political science. Most full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            &nbsp;buttons&nbsp;to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.jstor.org/">
             JSTOR
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of scholarly journals for most academic disciplines. The most recent three to five years of most journals are not included. Full text is linked directly in the database.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=ofm">
             Omnifile
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of scholarly and non-scholarly journals covering various subjects including general sciences, humanities, social sciences, and business. Most full text is linked directly in the database; otherwise use the
            <strong>
             Check for Full Text
            </strong>
            &nbsp;buttons&nbsp;to check for full text online or in the library.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            News
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://www.lexisnexis.com/hottopics/lnacademic">
             LexisNexis Academic
            </a>
            <br />
            A database of popular newspapers, magazines, and broadcast transcripts, as well as business publications, legal materials, and more. Full text is linked directly in the database.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17115967" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18459749">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18459749">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18459749">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Getting the Full Text of Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content10536644">
          <p>
           To get the full text of an article, consider the following options:
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you are in Encompass Search or a library database, look for "Check for Full Text buttons," "Access Online," or "Check eResources" buttons. These buttons will take you the full text of the article or tell you that the full text cannot be found. If the full text is not available from Trexler Library, look for buttons to request the item from another library via interlibrary loan. Or go directly to the
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           request forms.
          </p>
          <p>
           - If you have citation information for the article (i.e., journal title, article title, publication year, etc.), type the information about your article in
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           on the library website. If the library subscribes to the full text, you will be directed to the article (see first bullet above). If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           - If Trexler Library does not have access to the full text of the article, search
           <a href="http://www.google.com/scholar">
            Google Scholar
           </a>
           by article title to see if the author has made a copy freely available online. If not, you can request a copy of the article via
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/services/interlibrary-loan.html">
            interlibrary loan
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt10536644" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18459751">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18459751">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18459751">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Books
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17118116">
          <p>
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discovery">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           finds information by searching through a massive collection of books, scholarly journals, newspapers and magazines, dissertations, conference proceedings, music, video, maps, and more.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <p>
           To find only books, use the Books limit on the left sidebar of your search results page. Many items will be in Trexler Library; note the call number and status of the item to check its location and availability. For items not in Trexler Library, use the Interlibrary Loan to request a copy from another library.
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17118116" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox17115969">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="17115969">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title17115969">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Government Documents
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17115969">
          <p>
           <strong>
            United States
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Muhlenberg College receives about 30% of all materials published by the U.S. Federal Government. These items cover a wide range of subject areas. All of the government documents that we receive have records in
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu" target="_blank">
            Encompass Search
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Selected Online Resources
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            Foreign Relations of the United States (1861-1960)
            <br />
            <a href="http://digicoll.library.wisc.edu/cgi-bin/FRUS/FRUS-idx?type=browse&amp;scope=FRUS.FRUS1">
             http://digicoll.library.wisc.edu/cgi-bin/FRUS/FRUS-idx?type=browse&amp;scope=FRUS.FRUS1
            </a>
            <br />
            "The Foreign Relations of the United States series is the official documentary historical record of major U.S. foreign policy decisions that have been declassified and edited for publication. [...] This digital facsimile of Foreign Relations of the United States is a project of the University of Wisconsin-Madison Libraries in collaboration with the University of Illinois at Chicago Libraries. This is an incomplete run from 1861-1960 with missing volumes being added as they can be acquired and processed."
           </p>
           <p>
            National Security Archive
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.gwu.edu/%7Ensarchiv/index.html">
             http://www.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/index.html
            </a>
            <br />
            "Combines [...] investigative journalism center, research institute on international affairs, library and archive of declassified U.S. documents" and more.
           </p>
           <p>
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com/congressional">
             ProQuest Congressional
            </a>
            <br />
            <em>
             Getting there: Library homepage -- Research -- Databases A-Z -- ProQuest Congressional
            </em>
            <br />
            Information from the U.S. legislature, including full text of bills, public laws, committee reports, House and Senate documents , Congressional Record, Federal Register, and more government information.&nbsp; Coverage dates vary.&nbsp;
            <strong>
             Note especially the availability of hearings (1970-present).
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            Treaties and Other International Acts Series
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.state.gov/s/l/treaty/tias/index.htm">
             http://www.state.gov/s/l/treaty/tias/index.htm
            </a>
            <br />
            "All treaties and international agreements other than treaties to which the United States has become a party" from 1996-present.
           </p>
           <p>
            US Department of State Office of the Historian
            <br />
            <a href="http://history.state.gov/">
             http://history.state.gov/
            </a>
            <br />
            "The Office of the Historian is responsible, under law, for the preparation and publication of the official documentary history of U.S. foreign policy in the Foreign Relations of the United States series."
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Other
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Governments on the World Wide Web
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.gksoft.com/govt/en/">
             http://www.gksoft.com/govt/en/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            World Legal Information Institute: Countries
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.worldlii.org/catalog/215.html">
             http://www.worldlii.org/catalog/215.html
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt17115969" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18459758">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18459758">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18459758">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Citing Your Sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content18459758">
          <p>
           For information on
           <strong>
            why to cite your sources
           </strong>
           and
           <strong>
            how to avoid plagiarism
           </strong>
           , see the
           <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3856388">
            Get Started with Library Research: Cite Sources
           </a>
           guide.
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            What you should do to avoid plagiarism
            <br />
            <a href="https://www.indiana.edu/~istd/shouldDo.html">
             https://www.indiana.edu/~istd/shouldDo.html
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Examples
            <br />
            <a href="https://www.indiana.edu/~istd/examples.html">
             https://www.indiana.edu/~istd/examples.html
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           For help using
           <strong>
            Chicago style
           </strong>
           , consult the following resources:
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <em>
             The Chicago manual of style
            </em>
            (16th ed., 2010)
            <br />
            Location:
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=Http://www.chicagomanualofstyle.org/16/contents.html">
             Online
            </a>
            or search Encompass Search by title or Ready Reference 808.027 C632m
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Chicago Manual of Style (Purdue Online Writing Lab)
            <br />
            <a href="http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/717/01/">
             http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/717/01/
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <ul>
           <li>
            Chicago/Turabian Documentation Style (Writing Center, University of Wisconsin--Madison)
            <br />
            <a href="http://www.wisc.edu/writing/Handbook/DocChicago.html" target="_blank">
             http://www.wisc.edu/writing/Handbook/DocChicago.html
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <p>
           For help with
           <strong>
            Zotero
           </strong>
           , a "free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share your research sources," see
           <a href="https://www.zotero.org/">
            https://www.zotero.org/
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18459758" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">
            <ul>
            </ul>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile4651966" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18459733">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18459733">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18459733">
          <div class="bi_links">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Need Help with Your Research?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_3" id="content17117745">
          <p>
           <em>
            Contact:
           </em>
          </p>
          <p>
           <b>
            Jen Jarson
           </b>
           <br />
           Social Sciences Reference Librarian
           <br />
           phone: 484-664-3552
           <br />
           email: jarson@muhlenberg.edu
           <br />
          </p>
          <p>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt17117745" class="boxatt">
           <div class="itemlist">

            &nbsp;&nbsp;
